intro: Cotylelobium asperum, commonly known as the rough cotylelobium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its rough, hairy stems and leaves are adaptations to its arid or semi-arid habitats. Cotylelobium asperum is also noted for its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters.
